isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING - HEATER SYSTEM: 9000 Pro Sleeper After 05/01/1997, and 9800 Model After 07/01/1997 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - BLEND-AIR UNIT

warning.para: Before performing any of the following procedures, read the SERVICE WARNINGS. Failure to read the service warnings and to be aware of the dangers involved when working with refrigerant could lead to serious personal injury.

note.para: Most components can be serviced without removing the Blend-Air unit. Do not remove the Blend-Air unit unless it is necessary for the service being performed.

step1.para: Make sure the key switch and A/C switch are OFF.
Close the heater water valves at the engine.
Recover the refrigerant from the Air Conditioning system. Refer to S16019, AIR CONDITIONING BASIC THEORY, SYSTEM DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE in the Master Service Manual.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury from hot coolant, do not remove the heater hoses from the heater core inlet and outlet until the cooling system has cooled down.

step1.para: Note how the heater hoses are connected to the heater core, and label the hoses for proper reconnection later. Remove the heater hoses from the heater core inlet and outlet tubes ( Figure 13).

figure.caption: Figure 13. Components Located Under the Cab

note.para: It is recommended that the heater hose inlet and outlet tubes be plugged or capped to prevent coolant from being released inside the cab during removal of the Blend-Air unit.

step1.para: Remove the plastic cover that covers the high and low pressure switches on the expansion valve.

Remove the 10 mm nut that secures the refrigerant lines to the expansion valve and remove the refrigerant lines from the expansion valve ( Figure 13). Cap or plug all hoses. Place tape over the openings in the expansion valve.
If the expansion valve is being removed from the evaporator, refer to EXPANSION VALVE, Remove.
Remove the unit mounting stud nuts and washers ( Figure 13).
Remove the passenger seat.
Remove the passenger side floor panel, as follows:

step2.para: Remove the scuff plate from door sill ( Figure 14).
Remove the screws securing the floor panel ( Figure 15).
Take out the floor panel, exposing the air ducts ( Figure 16).

step1.para: Remove the sheet metal screws securing the air ducts at the Blend-Air unit ( Figure 16).

figure.caption: Figure 16. Air Ducts to Blend-Air Unit

step1.para: (Models 92/93/94/9900) Disconnect the HOT-COLD cable at the control assembly as follows ( Figure 17).

step2.para: Remove switch panel, located above HVAC control assembly, from dash. (It is not necessary to disconnect the electrical harness.)
Access the HOT-COLD cable end through the hole in the dash where the switch panel was located.
Remove screw securing cable to control assembly and detach cable end from control assembly lever.

step1.para: (Model 9800) Disconnect the HOT-COLD cable at the control assembly as follows ( Figure 17).

step2.para: Remove mounting screws securing control assembly to the dash.
Slide control assembly out of dash to access the HOT-COLD cable.
Remove screw securing cable to control assembly and detach cable end from control assembly lever.

step1.para: Remove the passenger side kick panel to gain access to the electrical harness behind it.
Disconnect the Blend-Air unit electrical harness from the cab harness located behind the kick panel ( Figure 18).

figure.caption: Figure 18. Blend-Air Electrical Harness and Cab Harness Behind Kick Panel

step1.para: Note the placement of the clamps securing the harness between the Blend-Air unit and the electrical connector behind the kick panel; then remove the clamps.
Carefully lift the Blend-Air unit and remove it from the vehicle. The seal between the Blend-Air unit and the cab floor should come up with the Blend-Air unit.

svcsubproc.title: Install
svcsubproc.para: Position the Blend-Air unit housing assembly in the cab with mounting studs, tubes and pipes protruding through the floor. Insure that any electrical harnesses and/or control cables are routed correctly, and are not pinched.

step1.para: Install washer and nuts on the mounting studs ( Figure 19). Tighten mounting nuts to 22 to 28 lbf-ft (30 to 38 Nm).

Install the heater hoses on the heater core tubes making certain that the supply hose is on the inlet tube and the return hose on the outlet tube. The heater core inlet tube is the one nearest the center of the cab. Install the hose clamps ( Figure 19).
If the expansion valve must be installed, refer to EXPANSION VALVE, Install .

caution.para: In the following step, do not over-tighten the 10 mm lock nut (6 mm thread size). Too much torque will strip the threads on the stud, which will require replacing the expansion valve.

step1.para: Lubricate new O-rings with MINERAL-BASED refrigerant oil and slide them on both refrigerant line fittings that will be installed on the expansion valve. Position both fittings into the expansion valve openings. Slide the plate that holds the fittings in place onto the stud ( Figure 19 and Figure 7). Install the 10 mm lock nut and tighten to 80 to 90 lbf-in (9 to 10 Nm).

figure.caption: Figure 19. Under Cab Heater A/C Routing

step1.para: Check to be sure the low and high pressure switch electrical connectors are plugged into each switch.
Install the plastic cover (three screws) that covers the high and low pressure switches on the expansion valve.
Open the heater water valves at the engine.
Connect electrical wiring harness to the cab harness in the area of the passenger side kick panel ( Figure 18).
Install clamps to maintain the original routing of the electrical harness between the kick plate and the Blend-Air unit.
Install kick panel.
Secure air ducts in place with sheet metal screws ( Figure 16).
Install floor panel ( Figure 15).
Install floor mat ( Figure 14).
(Models 92/93/94/9900) Connect the HOT-COLD cable at the control assembly as follows ( Figure 17).

step2.para: Attach the cable end to the control assembly lever, then install screw to secure cable to control assembly.

To adjust the cable, refer to Control Cable - Adjustment (92/93/94/9900)
.

step1.para: (Model 9800) Connect the HOT-COLD cable at the control assembly as follows ( Figure 17).

step2.para: Attach the cable end to the control assembly lever, then install screw to secure cable to control assembly.
Slide control assembly into dash and secure with four mounting screws.
To adjust the cable, refer to Control Cable - Adjustment (9800) .

step1.para: Replace coolant lost during heater hose removal. Refer to the Operator's Manual for the correct type of coolant.
Evacuate and charge the air conditioning system as described in S16019, AIR CONDITIONING BASIC THEORY, SYSTEM DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE.

note.para: In the following step, to verify correct heater and A/C operation at the air duct outlets, the cover must be in place on the Blend-Air unit.

step1.para: Run engine and check system for leaks and proper operation.
Install Blend-Air unit cover and passenger seat. Refer to BLEND AIR UNIT COVER, Install.
